availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles F. Starling (Henderson County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Married to Mariah T. Starling. Resident in Henderson County in 1860. Captain of Captain James H. Holloway's Company in September 1861, called into the U.S. Service by General Robert Anderson to guard Lock No. 1 on the Green River. Lieutenant colonel of the 48th Regiment of Kentucky Militia (U.S.A.), resigning in June 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 1, p. 3.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Ward 2, p. 6.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 833.
KYR-0002-022-0038.
